jsalt
Class SaltedHashGenerator

java.lang.Object
  jsalt.SaltedHashGenerator

public class SaltedHashGenerator
extends java.lang.Object

This class aims to provide a simple API to generate salted hash encryptions for plain text passwords.

Author:
Peter P. Lupo

Constructor Summary
SaltedHashGenerator(StandardJSEAlgorithms algorithm)
          All the named Message Digest Algorithms present in JSE are supported by the use of the enum StandardJSEAlgorithms.
SaltedHashGenerator(StandardJSEAlgorithms algorithm, boolean encodeHashAsBase64)
          This constructor works as SaltedHashGenerator(StandardJSEAlgorithms) and provides a convenient way to set if the generated passwords should be encoded as Base64.
SaltedHashGenerator(java.lang.String algorithm)
          Sets the digest algorithm to use.
SaltedHashGenerator(java.lang.String algorithm, boolean encodeHashAsBase64)
          This constructor works as SaltedHashGenerator(String) and provides a convenient way to set if the generated passwords should be encoded as Base64.
 
Method Summary
 java.lang.String encodePassword(java.lang.String password, java.lang.Object salt)
          Encodes the password merged with the salt before encoding.

Constructor Detail

SaltedHashGenerator

public SaltedHashGenerator(java.lang.String algorithm)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Sets the digest algorithm to use. All the named Message Digest Algorithms present in JSE are supported plus external providers in the same way MessageDigester does.

Parameters:
algorithm - The algorihtm key name.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If a corresponding algorithm could not be found.

SaltedHashGenerator

public SaltedHashGenerator(StandardJSEAlgorithms algorithm)
All the named Message Digest Algorithms present in JSE are supported by the use of the enum StandardJSEAlgorithms.

Parameters:
algorithm - The algorithm to use.

SaltedHashGenerator

public SaltedHashGenerator(java.lang.String algorithm,
                           boolean encodeHashAsBase64)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
This constructor works as SaltedHashGenerator(String) and provides a convenient way to set if the generated passwords should be encoded as Base64.

Parameters:
algorithm - The algorithm key name.
encodeHashAsBase64 - true If the generated key should be encoded as Base64. Default is false.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If a corresponding algorithm could not be found.

SaltedHashGenerator

public SaltedHashGenerator(StandardJSEAlgorithms algorithm,
                           boolean encodeHashAsBase64)
This constructor works as SaltedHashGenerator(StandardJSEAlgorithms) and provides a convenient way to set if the generated passwords should be encoded as Base64.

Parameters:
algorithm - The algorithm to use.
encodeHashAsBase64 - true If the generated key should be encoded as Base64. Default is false.
Method Detail

encodePassword

public java.lang.String encodePassword(java.lang.String password,
                                       java.lang.Object salt)
Encodes the password merged with the salt before encoding.

Parameters:
password - The plain text password to be encrypted.
salt - The salt to be merged.
Returns:
Hex or base64 encoded string of password digest.
